mods.abstract: Highway map of Union County with a 1960 civil district overlay. An incredible amount of detail can bee seen in the depiction of structures within the county. Every farm unit, dwelling, group of dwellings, school, church, cemetery, store, business, post office , observation tower, quarry, sawmill, correctional institution, recreation hall, courthouse, guard or ranger station, and power substation is shown. Various roads and railroads are indicated by the legend. Geographic features such as the Clinch River, Norris Reservoir, Big Ridge State Park, streams, creeks. adn wildlife areas are shown.

Union County was formed in 1850 from parts of the five surrounding counties, Anderson, Campbell, Claiborne, Grainger, and Knox. It is supposedly named as it is the union of the five parent counties. Its county seat and largest town is Maynardville, originally called Liberty. It changed its name to honor Horace Maynard, who defended the county from Knox County's injunction to block its formation.

subject.topic: Clinch River (Va. and Tenn.) Norris Lake (Tenn.)
